Question
========
A researcher is interested in the percentage of Dutch people who sometimes feel unsafe on the street. In a survey of 81 people 37.5% answered that they sometimes felt unsafe on the street. He wants to calculate the 95% confidence interval of the percentage of Dutch people who sometimes feel unsafe on the street.  
  
In this case, what is the critical z-value or critical t-value that belongs to a 95% confidence level? Round to 2 decimal places.

Answerlist
----------
* 1,99
* 1,96
* 2,58
* 2,33
* 2,98
* 2,64

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------
* False
* True
* False
* False
* False
* False
